page.title: 08THE SCHOOL AT SALESBURY.
page.content: The first part of the present School was built in 1850,but in 1888 financial difficulties caused it to close.The amount of teaching varied with the prosperity of the parish : farmer's children,as in 1985,were more useful helping at home than learning at school.In 1898 it reopened with 70 scholars.However,when the Orphanage opened at Wilpshire in 1892,it was found necessary to enlarge the School - this was done 3 times before 1914. During the "baby boom" of the 1960's 3 Infant classrooms,a Hall,Staffroom, Kitchen and cloakrooms with toilets were installed. In 1985 Salesbury,St.Peter's,School has 205 pupils betwen the ages of 5 and 11.The curriculum is as wide as possible and sporting events flourish on the 1 1/2 acre field and in the local swimming baths.
